column4: Could someone help me figure a way to fix a corrupted wireless driver please?
type lshw interminal and copy paste to paste.ubuntu.com
have i help with theis before?
you have the wireless card disabled
yes, I figured the driver at Additional Drivers System Settings
what is the problem, specifically? is it not connecting to the internet or..

When I try to activate the driver I got this message: Sorry, installation of this driver failed. Please have a look at the log file for details: /var/log/jockey.log, and this is at : https://gist.github.com/3709071
if I figure this driver name I could try to reinstall it via cable network, what do you think?
ok, what did you install exatly.. i use broadcom to and have a script for it but you might need to uninstall something
after Ubuntu instalation it comes authomatically.
I did it via cable, just reintalled the driver. Thank you!
type 'sudo apt-get autoclean' and 'sudo apt-get clean'
